thread.title: Morrisons pulls meat product and urges shoppers 'not to eat it' after meningitis bug find
thread.title_full: Morrisons pulls meat product and urges shoppers 'not to eat it' after meningitis bug find

title: Morrisons pulls meat product and urges shoppers 'not to eat it' after meningitis bug find

organizations.name: morrisons ready to eat peppered beef slices

text:
Published 19th February 2017 
Morrisons RECALL: Ready to Eat Peppered Beef slices were found to contain a nasty bug at Morrisons “If you have bought the above product do not eat it.” The Food Standards Authority (FSA) 
Customers are being asked to hand back certain packets of cooked beef slices to the Morrisons they came from. 
An urgent safety notice read: “Our routine testing has identified the presence of low levels of Listeria in this product.” 
Listeria, the bacteria found in the meat, can cause muscle aches, diarrhoea and throwing up. 
In rare cases it can lead to meningitis – a serious and urgent disease which can include hearing loss, seizures and loss of limbs. 
Babies, pregnant women and people over age 65 are more at risk of becoming sick with the bug. 
Morrisons is warning anyone who bought the Ready To Eat slices not to consume them, but return it to the store and “receive a full refund”. 
Getty SUPER FOOD: No other products are thought to be affected by the bug 
The recall only applies to Morrisons Ready to Eat Peppered Beef Slices 150g which have a use by date of February 21. 
Sandwich-fillers and other meats of the same use by date are not thought to be affected. 
The Food Standards Authority (FSA), said: “If you have bought the above product do not eat it. Related Articles
